_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Semiconductor and Other Electronic Component Manufacturing
Semiconductor and Other Electronic Component Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary    

In order to comply with the Risk Management Program regulations, 40 CFR Part 68, mandated under the accidental release provisions of the Clean Air Act Amendments of 1990, the International Business Machines Corporation, (IBM) is submitting this Risk Management Plan for the East Fishkill Facility.

Hydrogen  and Ammonia at greater than 20% are  currently the only substances which are stored in quantities greater than the respective reporting thresholds and required to be included in this submission.  Ammonia at greater than 20% is stored at the Ammonia Treatment Plant and is covered by Prevention Program 2 .  Hydrogen is currently stored in a single location within the facility and  covered by Prevention Program 3. 
 
Prevention Program 2  Ammonia Treatment 

The PHA Team for Ammonia Treatment is comprised of Ammonia Treatment Plant Engineer (team leader), Safety representative, Treatment Plant operator, Controls Technician, and Design Firm representatives.  The results of each PHA are recorded and maintained on file.

Operating procedures for the Ammonia Treatment Plant were originally written by the manufacturer and design firms, with input from Ammonia Treatment Plant Engineer and involved employees using technical process descriptions and process safety information.  Operating procedures, as specified in the Ammonia Treatment Plant Operations O+ M Manual are available from Environmental  Engineering and Operations, (D/92D).

Training for the Ammonia Treatment Plant Operation is formulated and tracked by the  Ammonia Treatment Plant  Engineer and training records are maintained by D/92D manager.

Incident investigation program follows the IBM incident report procedure in the Safety & Health Manual Index 04-01-04A for fact determination, root cause analysis and recommendation implementation.

Prevention Program 3  Hydrogen Storage

A Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) for Hydrogen Storage is conducted on a five year schedule by the Process Hazard Ana

lysis Team.  The PHA team for Hydrogen is comprised of Gas Engineer (team leader), Safety representative for gases, Gas Technician, manufacturing representatives from site manufacturing organizations, Emergency Control representative, and engineer from Air Products (Vendor). 

Operating procedures for Hydrogen were written by the Gas Engineer using technical process descriptions and process safety information, and with input from the involved employees.  Operating procedures, as specified in the Process Safety Management (PSM) Documentation for the Hydrogen System, are available from Site Systems Engineering (D/20G) and Utility Plant and Bulk Gas operations (D/88B).  The operating procedure are documented as Bulk Gas Procedures or as Desk References, and are available in B/316. 

Training for Hydrogen is formulated and tracked by the Gas Engineer and training records are maintained by D/20G and D/88B managers.  
Incident investigation program follows the IBM incident report procedure in the Safety & Health Manual Index 04-01-04A for fact determination, root cause analysis and recommendation implementation.


Mechanical Integrity for Hydrogen is shared between the gas supplier and IBM.  The program consists of equipment lists and specifications, equipment history, and preventative maintenance procedures. 

Hot work permits for work on the  hydrogen system are issued by IBM (Emergency Control) or Air Products.  This permit issuing process includes a safety inspection of  the area.  

Quality assurance of the Management of Change (MOC) program for Hydrogen  is provided  by the Hydrogen  Storage Process Safety Management Owner.  The MOC is composed of a written program with elements delegated to appropriate members of the PSM team.  A copy of the documentation is maintained for the life of the process. 

Quality assurance of the hydrogen pre-startup review program is provided by the Hydrogen Storage  Process Safety Management Owner.   Documentation is maintained as part

the MOC program.  

Incident investigation program follows the IBM incident report procedure in the Safety & Health Manual Index 04-01-04A for fact determination, root cause analysis and recommendation implementation.
